1. Enter Edit Mode\nHold down three of the screen\'s four corners(left top, right top, right bottom) and you can enter the editing interface.

2. Editing pictures\nAfter entering edit mode, click the icon on the top right corner of the picture to edit pictures. For pictures you no longer need, you can click on the \"Delete this card\" option, the picture will then be removed from the course. Pictures can also be set with clicking animation effects. Animations are \"No animation\", \"Enlarge\", \"Enlarge and rotate\". Using animation effects can give kids a good visual cue.

3. Changing page layout\nClick \"Courseware Settings\" on the lower right corner of the screen to enter Courseware settings and you can set the page layout. Page layout includes two types: one picture in one page, four pictures in one page. For children who are just learning to use this APP or for children who have poor hand mobility, you should first set the page layout to a page with one picture.

4. Add a new card\nProcess for adding a new card: click \"Empty\" and click \"Create new\" click \"Take a photo\" to take your own picture or click \"Choose from album\" and select an appropriate photo, click \"use photos\" and then click \"Done\" entered the photo\'s name, then click \"Next\" and \"Record\". After the recording is completed, press \"stop\". Listen to your recording, and if you are not satisfied you can re-record, otherwise click \"Finish\".

5. Editing Courseware\nEnter edit mode, click on the drop-down menu between \"Done\" and \"library\" buttons. The menu will show the existing courseware and at bottom of the menu there is the \"New courseware\" button. You can either edit existing courseware to produce courseware that meets with your requirements, or you can also generate new courseware. ( 1 ) Re-editing existing courseware. Click existing courseware. After entering the courseware, you can delete existing images or set animation effect. You can click on \"empty\" and add pictures. Click on \"From library\", you can select appropriate pictures from the Library. Click on \"Create new\", pictures can be made in accordance to user needs. ( 2 )New courseware. Click on the \"New courseware\", enter the name of the new courseware, and then add pictures.

6. Designing courseware with categories\nWhen a child is able to select the correct picture in one category, you need to create multiple categories courseware. Like creating new courseware, add new courseware, and give the courseware a new name. Then add no longer a single picture, but a category of pictures. Specific procedures: Click the \"Empty\", click \"From library\".Click the \"plus\" button on the upper right corner, then add successfully. In edit mode, enter a category, afterwards you can add, delete and make other changes to the pictures in this category. To delete a category, click the icon on the top right corner, then click on the trashcan icon to delete the category.

The biggest advantage of Yuudee is that it can make appropriate courseware based on each child\'s situation. The Picture Communication System has a set of standardized training procedures and has been shown to enhance autistic children\'s social and communication skills. We have developed a set of training processes, refered to Picture Communication System process and the characteristics of Yuudee. Outside trainers should be proficient in using the application, in accordance with the training program, and follow the training procedures. We hope children will consciously use Yuudee to aid in them in expressing themselves. Below is an introduction to the Yuudee\'s training process.

Preparation: In order to fully mobilize and motivate children to participate in the training process and improve, positive reinforcement is a very important matter. Before starting training, the trainer should notice the food, toys, activities, etc. that childrenare particularly fond of in their daily schedules, and remember them as a candidates for positive reinforcement. These items should be made into pictures, and stored in a small gallery and used in the development of the Yuudee courseware.

The training is divided into five phases. The first two stages primarily enable children to set up consiouness to use Yuudee when they want to epress themselves. The first four stages of the training are needed before a children\'s ability to use Yuudee to express their needs is ready. The last stage is designed to allow kids to use Yuudee to perform every day functions. Limb auxiliary in the training should be completed by third helper. In order to allow the child to begin using Yuudee in everyday life, trainers will seize opportunities such as play time and training periods and let the children use Yuudee to express themselves. In the process of training, trainers should carefully record training content and the level obtained by the child, so that timely adjustments to the training content and schedule can be made.

Phase One Target: When children see the items they want, they will spontaneously click on the picture on the device.\n Training steps: 1. Develop courseware: Edit new courseware, add pictures that children particularly like. 2. Display the items in front of children, and stimulate their desire to get the items. 3. When the children reach for items, take his/her hand to click on the picture on the iPad. 4. After clicking successfully, immediately give him/her the items. When the kids get the item, the trainer have to give feedback by saying something, such as the name of the article. As the training progresses, try to gradually reduce auxiliary help. From original total assistance, reduce to only giving a small amount of help. In the beginning you can take his/her hand and place it in front of the ipad, and let him/her complete the clicking process. Gradually, you may prompt the hild by touch or language (such as \"point and I will give it to you\") then the child can click him/herself. Hopefully eventually the child can independently complete the process in the absence of any support. Trainers should pay attention to the use of language, to prevent heard into giving instructions. In addition, the trainer must maintain the participation motivation of child by changing positive reinforcement timely.

Phase II Target: When kids see the items they want, they can use the ipad in front of the trainer clicking on the right picture to obtain desired items.\n1. Courseware for this phase contains only one picture, and it is a picture that the child likes. 2. Firstly gradually increase the distance between the child and trainer. Then gradually increase the distance between the child and the iPad. Characteristic of the second phase is to promote the idea that children need more activity in order to get tems. 3. On the beginning of the process we can assist children to complete the training, but gradually reduce the help. 4. In order to encourage child to participate, trainer can be eating/playing in front of the child with something he/she likes to eat or play with. For example, when kids are playing, trainers can play with his or her favorite toy at certain distance from the child, making him/her use the iPad to click on pictures of the toy in front of trainer in order to play. 5. During this process you can create opportunities to improve the children\'s ability to start the interaction, such as teaching them how to attract the attention of trainers. When the child goes to the trainer, the trainer should not be focused on the child, so that the child will need to attract the attention of trainers, this process requires the child to learn how to attract others\' attention. 6. The number and type of reinforcers should be increased to maintain the children\'s interest and motivation. When using one positive reinforcement only, it is easy for children to lose interest, and not follow up with the training.

Phase III Target: Identify the picture. The goal is when a child wants an item, they will go to the device, hold the device up to the trainer, select the appropriate picture and click on the items they want to obtain .\nFirst, identify two objects. Develop courseware including two pictures, set the picture layout is \"one picture in one page\". Selected two items, one is which child likes and the other the child does not like. Then you can set different animations for the two pictures, the pictures of the child\'s favourite items are set to \"Enlarge\" or \"Enlarge and rotate\", and the picture child does not like are set to \"no animation\". If the child clicks on the picture of the item he/she does not like, just put the item next to him/her. When he/she clicks on pictures of itemshe/she likes, give timely physical and verbal praise, thus strengthening the behavior. When children can repeatedly choose their favorite items, we can go next step. Set the courseware to include two pictures both children like it or not, so that there is no particular preference between two items. Then after the kids click on a picture, do not immediately give him/her the appropriate items, but let him/her choose these two items. If the selected objects and the picture are matching, give the items immediately to him/her, and say the name of it. If the selected objects and click on the picture are inconsistent, do not let him/her take the items and enter the error correction process. Error correction process: 1.The trainer should stand in front of the child and say the name of the item which he/she want to take. 2. When the child is looking at the picture of the item, the trainer should encourage kids to click on the image, you may need to give physical aid when necessary to help the child to complete the task. 3. When the child clicks on the picture, the trainer should encourage child with language, but do not give him/her the items. Give your child non-related instructions, such as \"touch your ears.\" 4. When the child completes the instructed task, the trainer should attract them with what him/her want. 5. When the child clicks on the picture, physical and verbal encouragement should be given timely. When the child can recognize two items, gradually increase the number of images, layout can also be changed to \"four pictures in one page\".

Phase IV Target: Child can answer the question \"what do you want?\"\nTrainer first ask the child \"what do you want?\" If they spontaneously click on the right picture, the trainer should point to the picture on the device repeating \"I want **\", and give a prize to the child. In order to promote the child to speak, the trainer should say, \"I want\" and pause, hoping the child will say the names of the wanted items. Children should be given prizes after saying the correct names of items. If the child does not take the initiative to click pictures, trainer should point to the iPad and ask \"what do you want?\”. If necessary, the child should be given physical support to complete the task, but support should slowly be reduced in order to achieve the ultimate goal that the child can independently answer training questions. As the training progresses, the trainer should reduce the frequency of finger pointing to the iPad, till at last not pointing to the iPad.

Phase V Target: The goal here is to have the child answer questions such as \"what did you see?\", \"what did you hear?\" and so on, or even to spontaneously evaluate his/her surrounding environment.\nAs the training before, trainer should make trainings to teach child answer these questions. But pay attention that the reinforcering prizes should not be the one used in the training of these two questions, so that child can set up consciousness that these two questions are separated from expression of demand. When the child correctly answer the question \"what did you see?\"，we can mix up \"what did you see?\" and \"what do you want?\" and let child answer. When answering \"what do you want?\", use the item he/she wants as reinforcers. When answering, \"what did you see?\", use other items or even verbal praise as reinforcers. Items or activities in questions can start from things he/she is familiar with and then be gradually expand. As the training progresses, train the child to answer more questions with Yuudee (such as questions to express feelings), later children should be able to express themselves without having to be asked specific questions.
